Posts.Content: Hi Sacha I am like you and had invasive Lobular cancer. I have to admit the invasive bit wasn't known until after the surgery but although it was invasive my sentinal lymph node was clear so no spread. I had my surgery 6 weeks ago and got word today to go see the Oncologist to start Radiotherapy and then like you medication to stop the oestrogen production. Mine was HER negative which means that it is not genetic. There doesnt seem any rhyme nor reason to why this happens but I was very lucky as I didnt know it was there and got picked up by the screening unit.  You will be shell shocked at the moment it is a lot to take in but you will be in the best of hands with the breast care team and they will support you every step of the way. My one piece of advice to you is to stay OFF google its scarey and as I have discovered each and every one of us is different. Good luck and happy to chat if you want too. xx
Posts.Title: I don't quite understand

Posts.Content: Good luck Wilson81 Its is a scarey time but you are not alone so come back and let us know how it all goes for you.  Good thing you are not going on your own and hubby is always a good person to have with you.
Posts.Title: Got my referral - Wednesday morning

Posts.Content: Good for you Seapebbles for letting it out its best to do that as holding it in can just make you feel worse. I don't know what to say to offer re assurance except to say that no-one knows what it is yet and it could be many things listen to your rational brain if you can. Its not easy and you will be worried and weepy and all that is perfectly ok its scarey waiting and then going to see people and finding out what it is but you are going to be seen in the right place by the right people and people are here on the forum for you to talk with if you dont want to talk to family. The other thing to remember on top of this is your nan and how unwell she has been and how well you have cared for her. Its  a hard time for you at the moment but keep your chin up and take a day at a time if you can .
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer referral after my nans passed away from cancer the same...

Posts.Content: Hi Ossy your emotions will be all over the place and just because you haven't had treatment as you say you have lost your breast and that.s treatment Ossy. You cry if you want to and shout at the world if you want to. You are entitled to have your off days when you are not feeling so good and feeling sorry or your self allow yourself some time and space and take each day as it comes and be kind to yourself Ossy. Have you got a breast care nurse because they can get you someone to talk with and are there any cancer support groups near you? I didn't think a group would be something I would ever do but I went along to one last week and I am sooo glad I did I felt sooo much better when I came out. Sending big hugs. xx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Hi Lovemypug I haven't had that experience as my Gp has been great she is always so kind and caring I couldn't fault her. However, I think you need to talk to this GP face to face ad maybe ask them if you are bothering them as they seem so busy. (tongue in cheek) Hopefully that will make them sit up and take some notice that's shocking whats happening to you. This person needs  a stern talking to about how they are treating patients that's not right at all. You must be a very patient person I would have blown at the point where he answered an email -how rude of him. You deserve better than that. x Can you see another GP? x
Posts.Title: GP support ?

Posts.Content: Hi JANEYS47  that must be very difficult for you and I use devil's claw for joint pain and they told me at pre op to stop using it till after surgery I'm unclear what impact either of the meds you are taking would have on surgery have they given you another date or any idea of timescales ? it is scarey what's happening for you Jane just take a day at a time and let us know how you get on xx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed and scared.

Posts.Content: Hi Emily I am of the opinion that anything that makes you feel better about things is the right thing to do so do what you think is best for YOU. XXX
Posts.Title: Sudden pain when pressed

Posts.Content: Hi Emily it sounds like you are being fast tracked and I would press the breast clinic for an appointment and see when thats coming to you. If you are really worried I would go back to your GP its worth it just to speak to a medical person while you wait -maybe help .
Posts.Title: Sudden pain when pressed

Posts.Content: Hi Little Booboo I am like your self and a larger lady and I found the sports bras in Asda the large or Xtra large are good they dont give you the same support as the underwires but they are ok and nice and soft and cheap at £6 each. Good luck with all your surgery and hope it all goes well for you.x
Posts.Title: Post surgery sports bras

Posts.Content: Hi Julie2014 That sounds like a total shambles for you. Is there a PALS service anywhere near you of do you need to give them a call asap. Do you have a link to a breast care nurse if so you need to speak to them urgently. Failing any of that I would write a strongly worded letter of complaint to the CEO of the hospitals involved someone has to be able to answer any questions you have. I can imagine that you will be feeling a whole host of emotions right now and who could blame you with all this going on for you. Hopefully maybe some of the other folks on hear may have some other advice for you and let us know how you get on. xxxxx
Posts.Title: Help I need advice

Posts.Content: Hi Sharmer No wonder you are shell shocked. It is awful waiting on the results and then hearing the news but it sounds like they have been really quick with you so that's good. Mine was invasive lobular with no lymph involvement so had my first radiotherapy today and it was ok. I had my lumpectomy in April and wound healing well. It doesn't matter how much you prepare yourself when they say the words breast cancer the world seems to stop. I have managed to keep quite perky but have had so many down days as well and you are allowed those Sharmer. I had a good cry after I came out from my consultant and then got myself together and gave myself a good talking to and said no point crying I need every ounce of energy for what might be in front of me. You will be so shocked and if I have one piece of advice for you its to stay off the internet as I did that and scared the life out of myself.    sending you big hugs and stay strong in the face of what you may have to come and let us all know how you are and how you get on. xxxx
Posts.Title: ... started my journey today

Posts.Content: Hi Laura0403 Your mum will be overwhelmed by what has happened to her and what is happening now. Tell your mum from me that she musn't give up she will come through the other end it may be a long journey but journey it is and she will get there. It is probably all very overwhelming for her Laura and hopefully she will bounce back before too long. All you can do is be there for her and give plenty of hugs which I am sure that you will be doing.  Hope it all goes well and that your mum feels better soon. x
Posts.Title: Mom diagnosed with invasive lobular breast cancer
